prompt: Please read the following arguments for and against reducing university tuition fees.

text_two: The current tuition fee system is not even ten years old and we already have a crisis where many UK graduates are never expected to pay off their debts in full.
prompt: Please read the following two arguments in favour of reducing university tuition fees.

description: Currently, students studying in England pay university tuition fees of up to £9250, with all students entitled to receive a loan to cover fees and living expenses. Some people are in favour of reducing tuition fees ("for"), while others are opposed ("against").
text_one: Since only high earners fully pay back their loans under the current system, lowering fees will have the unintended effect of primarily benefitting those who earn the most.
